cd:Integer.cd:Description: No valid data flag. 0 = valid data was found in the Level 0 product; 1 = no valid packets in the Level 0 product.
Internal straylight correction flag. 1 = internal straylight correction was not performed; 0 = internal straylight correction was performed.
External earth straylight correction flag. 1 = external earth straylight correction was not performed; 0 = otherwise.
External sun straylight correction flag. 1 = external sun straylight correction was not performed; 0 = otherwise.
Slit transmission correction flag. 1 = slit transmission correction was not performed; 0 = otherwise.

PCD flag for reference star spectrum computation. 0 = no problem; 1 = the reference star spectrum was computed with a small number of measurements; 2 = no valid measurements in the occultation to compute the reference star spectrum (see ref_star_db and no_ref_star).

PCD flag indicating that the star spectrum has been read from the stellar spectra database. 0 = the reference spectrum is computed from the measurements; 1 = the reference spectrum is read in the database; 2 = the reference spectrum was not found in the stellar spectra data base (see no_ref_star).
PCD flag indicating that the reference star spectrum has not been computed. 1 = the reference star spectrum has not been computed; 0 = the reference star spectrum was computed.

PCD flag indicating that the automatic dark charge bias correction has been applied. bit 0: automatic dark charge bias correction activated (1) or not (0) for SPA1. bit 1: automatic dark charge bias correction activated (1) or not (0) for SPA2. bit 2: automatic dark charge bias correction activated (1) or not (0) for SPB1. bit 3: automatic dark charge bias correction activated (1) or not (0) for SPB2.
PCD flag for the dark charge computation (photometers). 1 = no DC correction performed; 0 = DC correction performed.
Number of source packets containing errors. This value wil equal the number of Transmission MDSRs with their quality flag set to -1.
Level 0 PCD. 0 = standard occultation; 1 = first part of a tangent occultation; 2 = last part of a tangent occultation

Type of atmosphere file used. 54 = One ECMWF file used. Time recorded is included in the occultation period; 102 = One ECMWF file used. Time recorded before the beginning of the occultation (Delta t <= 24h); 103 = One ECMWF file used. Time recorded after the beginning of the occultation (Delta t <= 24h); 106 = One ECMWF file used. Only one time record in the validity interval (Delta t <= 24h); 155 = Two ECMWF files used; 201 = No ECMWF file available. Use MSIS model alone; 202 = Only old ECMWF files (Delta t >= 24h). Use MSIS model alone; 203 = Only future ECMWF files (Delta t >= 24h). Use MSIS model alone; 206 = No ECMWF file available in the validity interval (Delta t >= 24h). Use MSIS model alone.

Dark charge correction information. 0 = dark charge map used; 1 = first measurements used; 2 = no dark charge correction applied; 11 = first measurements not available - DC corrections with DC maps; 12 = first measurements not available and missing first packet - DC correction with DC maps without temperature dependence; 21 = dark charge map computed from DSA observation has been used.
Dark/bright limb condition. 0 = dark limb; 1 = bright limb.
Observation illumination condition. 0 = full dark limb condition; 1 = bright limb condition; 2 = pure twilight condition; 3 = straylight condition; 4 = twilight and straylight condition.
SDP extraction processing. Number of invalid measurements during the occultation.
Datation errors. Number of measurements where flags were raised to indicate a datation problem occurred.
Ray tracing errors. Number of measurements with a non-converged ray path.
Geolocation errors. Number of measurements performed outside the atmosphere, set to 1000 if completely performed outside the atmosphere.
Saturation errors. Number of measurements containing saturated samples.
Cosmic ray errors. Number of measurements where cosmic rays have been detected.
Modulation correction errors. Number of measurements where a modulation correction error has been detected.
Vignetting correction. Number of measurements where the vignetting correction was applied.
Central Background. Number of measurements where FLAGbg(f) has been raised.
Flat field correction. Number of measurements where the star falls outside the central band.
Full transmission errors. Number of measurements where a problem has been detected during the full transmission computation.
Bad Pixels. Number of bad pixels per measurement

cd:Array.cd:Description: Photometer saturation. Number of photometers saturated samples. First number is for photometer 1 second is for photometer 2

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Background correction flag. 0 = no background correction; 1 = background correction applied (linear interpolation); 2 = background correction applied (exponential interpolation); 3 = background correction applied (general method).
